author: synaxx
title: token system for the world of work
description: Worldwide, there is still no ecosystem that creates incentives, creates conditions in which the world of work is valued and promoted.

f6_assessments.q0:
Firstly, I fail to identify the link between the project and the challenge, then, I can’t find a real explanation about the problem statement.
I quote: “Worldwide, there is still no ecosystem that creates incentives, creates conditions in which the world of work is valued and promoted.”
What does it mean? It is a little bit hard to understand, maybe because the proposal has been translated using an App or Google Translate.
I would suggest the proposer to look for partners who can help for translation.

It seems that the proposer found out that the “world of work” needs to be promoted, in some ways. It would be very helpful to know how the team comes to a conclusion like this.

Another strange statement: “Creates incentives to create decent working conditions worldwide”
It looks like normal wage, in my humble opinion.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer did not provide any link to confirm his past experiences. 

The roadmap is literally starting by the statement: “Quit my job”
How does the proposer think this can reassure the community about the seriousness of the project?

The budget is not explained nor broken down and will be very hard to assess.
Additional funding will be required, but we don’t know the reason yet.

Technical aspects for implementation are missing, and I hardly understand the goal of the whole project.
f6_assessments.q2:
The way to keep track of the project will be via Github, but no link has been provided, and with the roadmap. Once more, I can’t understand how the roadmap could help in that matter.

It is really hard to know exactly what the proposer is trying to say about success, here: “Having an ecosystem that manages, supports itself, the cash flow is right and both intrinsic motivation and extrinsic motivation are present. And it continues to provide incentives for all users to expand the shaft of this ecosystem.”

To conclude, i will kindly ask the proposer to read (once again?) the "proposers guide”

https://catalyst-swarm.gitbook.io/the-catalyst-school/educational-resources/proposers-guide

f6_assessments.q0: Regarding the characteristics that we expect to find in the proposals of this challenge, we managed to find a certain alignment between what the project aims to build and the goals. However, although we understand the predominant context in which this project operates, the impact that would be generated with a possible success of the project is not so evident, since we were unable to find a greater detail of the purpose of the project, since the aforementioned ecosystem is finished. Also for this reason, it is not clear how it would be possible to bring value to the beneficial actions that the project will carry out, and this valuation would be one of the central points that we need to find in the ideas belonging to this fund. Furthermore, it is clear that, taking into account the aforementioned observations, the amount being requested of $100,116 is very high, not least because this amount would represent about 50% of the fund's resources.
f6_assessments.q1: Regarding the paths mentioned for the development of the project, we were able to observe a certain coherence in the actions to be carried out over time, since these activities start from simpler premises and gradually become more complex. However, it would be interesting if more details were given about these actions, for example, it is mentioned sometimes that more partners, developers and funders will be sought, but only with these statements there are still some doubts such as: what characteristics are being sought in these funders and partners? What would be the main technology required by the developer in question? These open-ended questions don't sit well with the relevant amount of about $100,000 being requested. And still in this context, given the initial situation in which the project finds itself, perhaps it would be nice if the total capital being requested here was smaller, it is that a good part of it was more focused on research and development, thus, since the central idea If the project had better-formed pillars, it would be possible to move on to a phase that required more intensive capital. Given the amounts being earmarked for different actions, we noticed that now the project already seems to be, precipitously, at this stage, requesting considerable amounts like around $20,000 dollars for website creation and optimization, but before that, as mentioned previously, it seems more It is interesting first to make a good definition of the actions that must be taken to create an ecosystem with enough traction to attract people and promote a positive impact on the job market. Regarding the professionals involved in the project, taking into account the breadth of markets and people that the project aims to reach, it seems significant that a better-formed team was already defined. The curriculum of the professional currently involved in the project is also not available at the moment, so that we can verify their experience.
f6_assessments.q2: Regarding the ways mentioned to follow the evolution of the project, we noticed that the two main ways indicated to verify the evolution are quite relevant, especially the use of github, since the project will have a strong technological bias. However, again, it seems constructive if more information were given here on how this follow-up will take place. For example, which system features will have higher priority to be developed and, consequently, how long can we expect these features to be implemented and placed on github as a form of verification. Additionally, it seems pertinent to mention the future monitoring of this development by Cardano members with technical knowledge in the area. Likewise, it would be nice if the aforementioned roadmap already had an outline so that we can better understand how the follow-up should take place. Finally, regarding the perception of success, a positive point would be the presence of quantitative parameters that would help us to measure the scope of the initiative. Some quantitative targets could be established, such as an average number of workers using the platform after a certain period of time after its launch or an expected proportion between employers and employees using the system.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal wishes to create a token system which provides incentives for all people to work. The token would actually promote and create incentives for reasonable working conditions, would collect information on employment and would advocate for equitable treatment for all stakeholders. Such a tall order from the first sentence! 

I find the proposal rather unrealistic through its very broad scope. It’s impossible to create change in the entire world employment ecosystem without focusing on a clear solution or on a clear problem to resolve. We are faced with a vaguely described solution and we are not being offered too many details regarding it. 

Considering all of the above, I can only offer two stars since I am not convinced that the proposal would be a great addition to the Cardano ecosystem if implemented.
f6_assessments.q1:
The feasibility of this proposal is questionable at best. Let me offer a few points of view as to why. First, the budget split does not look feasible. A third of the budget would be spent on incorporating a company in Germany - which to my mind is an excessive amount and not a good use of funds. Second, marketing costs would be 26k USD and website creation an additional 21k USD, without any split according to the actual tasks, applicable hourly rates or any description as to who exactly will be actually building. On top of this, there is another 7k USD caption to include finishing the business plan and a whitepaper. I find the budget completely unfeasible. 

We have a similar problem when it comes to the team behind the proposal - sadly there isn’t one. The proposer simply says that he will ask around for people interested in building the solution with him. Again, not having a team in place when asking for 100k USD is definitely an additional red flag. 

A similar experience hits us when looking at the roadmap. The project would be split in five quarters. A big surprise comes in the Q1, when the proposer informs us that the necessary steps of the project will be to (1) quit his job, (2) finish the whitepaper, (3) incorporate the company and (4) find more business partners. So in other words one fifth of the project would involve offering time for the proposer to cut his existing attachments and finish the idea behind this proposal. Needless to say that this is very unconvincing. A similar poor experience exists when going into the details of the other stages, but I shall spare you of the details. 
 
All in all there are extremely high chances that it will not be feasible to finish this project according to the existing plan. This is one of the first times I am offering one star to any of the projects, but it is the only mark deemed correct in this case.
f6_assessments.q2:
If you’ve made it this far, it probably comes as no surprise that the auditability section is weak as well. We are offered a few vague words, but they are not very informative: “Having an ecosystem that manages, supports itself, the cash flow is right and both intrinsic motivation and extrinsic motivation are present”. What does that mean exactly? We are not being told.

So far the team is a one-man-show, so there are of course no communication channels open for the Cardano community to interact with the project, if funded (Telegram Twitter, etcetera). Given all the above information we cannot really trust that the project will be easy to audit / interact with, hence two stars I deem as sufficient.

f6_assessments.q0: The impact of this project is unclear as it is so broad - all workers and all employees can be involved! There is no description of how improving working conditions could be rewarded or why companies would get involved. This is unfortunate as there is definitely a need for improved conditions in many fields and a desire, from the proposer to address the various issues. There is no clear definition of a problem, or description of a solution. The parameters of concern really need to be clearly defined and considered in the context of the Cardano ecosystem. There is no information regarding how the Cardano community will benefit from this initiative or how Cardano will be utilised.
f6_assessments.q1: There is no information regarding skills or relevant experience of the proposer which is impeded the possibility to determine feasibility. The budget is asking for more than half the funds available which seems unreasonable as this project is quite vague, at best. There needs to be a more specific breakdown of what the objectives and tasks are so that a timeline can be created with achievable goals. There is not enough information regarding measurable goals or expenses. The onboarding of needed collaborators needs to occur to increase confidence in the feasibility of this proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: There are no KPIs or timelines for this proposal. success is defined in broad terms which are difficult to define as actual outcomes or measurable end goals. There is no means of tracking actual purpose, success or impact. There is no apparent link to the Cardano community with regard to auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: The plan is to build a token system to incentivize proper working conditions, sustainable practices and fair treatment for the work globally. If the system succeeded in capturing information created from this, it would direct the actions toward more valuable and beneficial behavior. The proposal does not provide details about how exactly the system facilitates this goal. Thus the overall impact to goals, specified in the challenge brief, is unclear. This is an early vision but not a viable proposal yet.
f6_assessments.q1:
There is no team required to start the implementation of the proposal. The next step would be finding partners who share the same vision. 

There is a rough budget breakdown but more detailed information is needed. The amount asked may be reasonable but with this little information it is impossible to evaluate. It might be useful to divide the proposal into smaller pieces and ask for less funding to implement one step at a time. Risks of this proposal, as it is now, are wide and significant.
f6_assessments.q2:
The implementation steps are building a team, writing a whitepaper and creating a business plan and buying legal advice. These are large and high risk tasks and require much more detailed planning with measurable metrics to be reasonably auditable. 
KPIs after completion are qualitative descriptions about the amount of the platform used. Quantifiable goals/estimates would be preferable even if they were highly uncertain.

f6_assessments.q0:
Your plan is to establish a token ecosystem from which you will conduct employment placement and candidate recruitment. Make use of that token to enable trading as well as to pay and cover transaction fees for other users. That is a good idea. However, there are a few problems with the way that you present the problem that the solution to the project can solve the challenge: Regarding the numerical statistics, we are of the same opinion. People are working all over the world, and I believe that number is likely to be even larger, but constructing a system or an application that people can know and use is a different matter. I really have not seen any solutions that are effective and positive as well as specific for you to solve the problem that has been posed. In addition, I am of the opinion that the suggestion might be better suited for the competition titled "Dapps, products, and integrations." as a result of the fact that constructing a system and an application will be included in that aspect of the challenge.

Concerning the danger you pointed out, considering the size of the undertaking at hand and the fact that you are presently without a companion and have not established a solid community for yourself, it is extremely challenging and even more challenging to determine what you should do next. You only have ideas, no significant internal capacity, or significant economic or professional factors; in addition, you are looking for companions in the near future. I also hope that in the not-too-distant future, you will have a companion to help you through the process of submitting this grant application, so that you can review the content and also submit it to other challenges that are more reasonable. Therefore, I will award this impact two points.
f6_assessments.q1:
In regard to the roadmap you presented, the project will be finished by the second quarter of 2023 and will be an ICO. However, in all candor, it has been an entire year since the first phase of the project, which lasted from the second quarter of 2022 to the second quarter of 2023. I see that you always want to find someone. Find partners with whom you can grow and work together. The fact that you are going to quit your current job and devote yourself entirely to this endeavor is indicative of your level of determination. However, this is not sufficient on its own. For instance, you have a very robust community, which enables you to receive assistance from the community, or you have been familiar with the Cardano Blockchain for a significant amount of time, which enables you to easily comprehend it and gain access to it. Or that you are able to program with the Haskell programming language... These are the advantages that will allow you to succeed and build the best project possible. However, the reality is that you do not possess anything.

In regard to the budget that you mentioned in the proposal, I require additional information for each of the categories that you mentioned. Additionally, the content that you mentioned does not seem to be proportionate or consistent with the roadmap that you provide. For instance, Creating a website and optimizing it according to the roadmap will be in the fourth quarter, but you leave it in the second line, equivalent to the third quarter. The establishment of the company will take place in the second quarter of 2022, and after that, you leave it in the final item equivalent to the second quarter of 2023. And in all honesty, the costs that you provide are far too general and not specific, such as the fact that developing a website and optimizing it will incorporate any small expenses into it, or developing smart contracts and establishing them. You need an excel sheet to be able to list and describe all those fees, and you need to know what specific expenses the company needs, so that the community can clearly see the transparency and trust in the project. your judgment.

Concerning Capability: You stated that you have "Product experience, process experience, industry experience, customers and candidates experience, technical know-how," but in order to verify that, what you mentioned really doesn't have a path to follow. a link to a video or an explanation of the capacity issue that you have raised. You also mentioned that you are searching for businesses and other factors to develop the project. However, your project needs to be extremely open and transparent; if it is, it is likely to attract a large number of people as well as a large number of talented businesses. help you out and be by your side. As a result, I will award you two points for this facet of your possible outcomes.
f6_assessments.q2: There is no link, so there is no way for the community to follow them on Github, your personal page, or any other project you may have. You have not yet measured the progress of the project or its key performance indicators (KPIs), which is really important if the project is to be funded and requires the participation of the community in order to be able to track and monitor its progress. Quantitative metrics, such as the number of people who have used the application after three months, six months, and one year; community support as measured by the number of logins; and There are many indicators that can be used to determine whether or not a project was successful. Therefore, I will award one point for this degree of auditability.
